{{cpp/chrono/title|current_zone}}
{{cpp/chrono/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=chrono|since=c++20|
const std::chrono::time_zone* current_zone();
}}

Convenience function for obtaining local time zone from the time zone database. Equivalent to {{c|std::chrono::get_tzdb().current_zone()}}.

=== Exceptions ===
{{lc|std::runtime_error}} if this is the first reference to the time zone database and the time zone database cannot be initialized.

=== Notes ===
A call to this function that is the first reference to the time zone database will cause it to be initialized.

=== Example ===
{{example|code=
#include &lt;chrono&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main() {
    const std::chrono::zoned_time cur_time{ std::chrono::current_zone(),
                                            std::chrono::system_clock::now() };
    std::cout &lt;&lt; cur_time &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
 | p=true
 | output=2021-09-13 19:46:42.249182012 MAGT
}}
